Container.Name: Ghost
Container.Overview: Ghost is a free and open-source blogging platform written in JavaScript and distributed under the MIT License, designed to simplify the process of online publishing for individual bloggers as well as online publications. This version includes mapping for MariaDB and SMTP. Big credits to Bitnami for the amazing image. Another fine product, brought to you by IBRACORP.

Config.Name: GHOST_PORT_NUMBER
Config.Description: Port number used in the generated application URLs. Default: 80

Config.Name: GHOST_HOST
Config.Description: If you want to access your application from a public IP or hostname you need to set this environment variable to your public IP or hostname. E.g. blog.example.com

Config.Name: GHOST_EMAIL
Config.Description: Ghost application email. Default: user@example.com

Config.Name: BLOG_TITLE
Config.Description: Ghost blog title. Default: User's Blog

Config.Name: MARIADB_HOST
Config.Description: Hostname for MariaDB server. Default: mariadb

Config.Name: MARIADB_PORT_NUMBER
Config.Description: Port used by MariaDB server. Default: 3306

Config.Name: GHOST_DATABASE_NAME
Config.Description: Database name that Ghost will use to connect with the database. Default: bitnami_ghost

Config.Name: GHOST_DATABASE_USER
Config.Description: Database user that Ghost will use to connect with the database. Default: bn_ghost

Config.Name: GHOST_DATABASE_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Database password that Ghost will use to connect with the database. No defaults.

Config.Name: ALLOW_EMPTY_PASSWORD
Config.Description: It can be used to allow blank passwords. Default: no

Config.Name: SMTP_HOST
Config.Description: SMTP host. E.g. smtp.gmail.com

Config.Name: SMTP_PORT
Config.Description: SMTP port. E.g. 587

Config.Name: SMTP_USER
Config.Description: SMTP account user. E.g. your_email@gmail.com

Config.Name: SMTP_PASSWORD
Config.Description: SMTP account password.

Config.Name: SMTP_FROM_ADDRESS
Config.Description: SMTP from address.

Config.Name: SMTP_SERVICE
Config.Description: SMTP service to use. E.g. GMail or Mailgun

Config.Name: SMTP_SECURE_CONNECTION
Config.Description: Use a secure connection for SMTP. true or false
